text: the following report contains some
disturbing images
the Cape Flats notorious for gang wars
and drugs it has one of the highest
murder rates in the world in Hanover
Park alone 20 gangs vie for territory
and yet thousands of people call this
place home Kraven annual ceasefire
project works with former gangsters to
defuse tension on the streets but it is
high-risk area
gunfire every day and altercations every
day and I took activity on the streets
every day
Nigel David's is desperate to get out
his life of violence and drugs has taken
its toll my fringe of most of them got
shot dead then most of them are in
prison I was also in frozen and things
are not getting getting while some
shootings I intentional others a purely
victims caught in the crossfire
eight-year-old Ziad George was on his
way to the shops on a Sunday morning
when a stray bullet ended up in his
spine he will be disabled for life
another victim 18 year old Suleiman
Jacobs was about to take a bus to school
when again war erupted he is paralyzed
from the waist down it's already been
faulted in a shot spotter now technology
may help to reduce the carnage on
Hanover Park streets audio sensors in
the area I linked to a central GPS
system that plot gunfire as it happens
allowing both the police and the
ceasefire project to intervene just be
shooting from that particular area
but traditional policing methods remain
effective after a tip-off two unlicensed
firearms are found in a rented that room
they owners nowhere to be seen the
owners of the house rejoice that night
the gangsters returned
they're both shot he dies tragically
another patrol I never stop and search
the police have been on patrol for
several hours now here in Hanover Park
but it seems to be a quiet night but in
communities such as this one the
situation can change at any moment
despite the many efforts young people
here still face a life of fear and
danger
nam sama say go BBC News Cape Town
